description: Unique identifier of the singleton system settings record for this environment.
Identifier of the customer/tenant or administrative owner associated with this system configuration; confirm with SME.
Stored encrypted/hashed application password or key used by the system for background/authentication tasks; confirm with SME.
Default format used to display and parse dates across the application.
Inactivity timeout, in minutes, before desktop sessions automatically sign out.
Inactivity timeout, in minutes, before mobile sessions automatically sign out.
Minimum number of characters required for user passwords.
Level/flags defining required password complexity (e.g., mix of case, numbers, symbols).
Toggle to enable Windows/Active Directory integrated authentication for user logins.
Whether Windows/AD password policies are enforced for application passwords; confirm with SME.
Number of days before passwords must be changed; zero typically disables expiration.
User or process that created the settings record (audit).
Timestamp when the settings record was created (audit).
User who last modified the settings (audit).
Timestamp when the settings were last modified (audit).
Flag indicating this environment is a model/template database rather than production; confirm with SME.
Default or primary work group code used system-wide for assignments and permissions; confirm with SME.
Setting controlling whether street addresses are validated against a reference dataset/service; confirm with SME.
Attachment reference for the organization’s logo used in application branding.
Number of consecutive failed login attempts allowed before an account is locked.
Attachment reference for the mobile client’s logo/branding; confirm with SME.
Configured display height for the logo image, typically in pixels.
Default phone number mask/format used for input validation and display.
Default country code used to format and validate phone numbers.
Inactivity timeout, in minutes, for public/portal user sessions.
Attachment reference for the dark-theme logo used in branding.
Maximum number of work orders downloaded to a mobile device for offline use.
Default city prefilled on new addresses or records.
Default state/province prefilled on new addresses or records.
Comma-separated contacts to notify when the application version is updated.
Maximum allowed file size for uploaded images/attachments; units may be MB or bytes—confirm with SME.
Whether the application uses metric measurements instead of US customary units.
Number of days closed work orders remain visible/synced on mobile devices; confirm with SME.
Time zone offset applied to system times (likely hours from UTC); confirm units with SME.
Timestamp when the currently installed application version was released or applied.
Default preference to show only the signed-in user’s work orders on mobile.
Setting that likely disallows consecutive duplicate characters in passwords or duplicate entries; confirm scope with SME.
Whether passwords may include consecutive duplicate characters (e.g., repeated letters or numbers).
